topic.title: Decentralized Youtube?
topic.body: I don't know if anyone's noticed but a lot of youtube videos are not monetized, get taken down or worse just because the shareholders and the CEO hold biased values. Zeronet seems to have opened up a new area on the internet governed directly by the people instead of these idiots at the top. I don't care if its AOC screaming the top of her lungs for the green new deal, Alex jones making conspiracy theories or maybe even ISIL uploading a new terror video. People will be free to express their opinions and be held accountable for their actions by everyone else, not just a biased silicon valley. So would a decentralized version of youtube work well in this modern world of political correctness?

1605268368_1LKV9xTJGWsmvJNHYC5Y7KPSiUY48.body: i don't care. lets talk about boobs

> [styromaniac](#comment_2688_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): If you think you're funny enough to spam comments like this, then you will end up on a spam blocklist. Nobody's laughing, despite how awesome boobs can be. Just putting that out there. [...]

meh, i'll just create a new id. joke's on you though, you got triggered.

> [styromaniac](#comment_2690_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd): I don't recommend it. [...]

Definitely triggered.

1605294278_1KNkHfHESMzY6Lg7wCVkMzY5a4Ren.body:
> [freemankind](#comment_47_17AwNLQUY1CRAb1U6jVJhvVUnyEdNvkiue): there are multiple decentralized youtube alternatives just do a proper search. [...]

Nothing as good as youtube and nothing that monetises for the uploaders.
